query.failConditionTooltip1: Customize failure conditions and corresponding notifications.
query.failConditionTooltip2: If any condition returns true, the query is marked as failed and triggers the corresponding notification.
query.notifyDurationTooltip: Notification duration. Time unit can be 's' (second, default) or 'ms' (millisecond). Default value is {default}s. Maximum is {max}s.
query.confirmationMessage: Are you sure you want to run this Data Query?
query.triggerTypeAuto: Inputs Change or On Page Load
query.triggerTypeManual: Only when you trigger it manually
query.updateExceptionDataSourceContent: Update the following query with the same failing data source:
query.disablePreparedStatementTooltip: Disabling prepared statements can generate dynamic SQL, but increases the risk of SQL injection
query.timeoutTooltip: Default unit: ms. Supported input units: ms, s. Default value: {defaultSeconds} seconds. Maximum value: {maxSeconds} seconds. E.g., 300 (i.e., 300ms), 800ms, 5s.
query.periodicTimeTooltip: Period between successive executions. Default unit: ms. Supported input units: ms, s. Minimum value: 100ms. Periodical execution is disabled for values below 100ms. E.g., 300 (i.e., 300ms), 800ms, 5s.
query.cancelPrevious: Ignore Results of Previous Uncompleted Executions
query.cancelPreviousTooltip: If a new execution is triggered, the result of the previous uncompleted executions will be ignored if they did not complete, and these ignored executions will not trigger the event list of the query.
query.dataSourceStatusError: If a new execution is triggered, the result of the previous uncompleted executions will be ignored if the previous executions did not complete, and the ignored executions will not trigger the event list of the query.
query.execIgnored: The Results of This Query Were Ignored
query.deleteSuccessMessage: Successfully Deleted. You Can Use {undoKey} to Undo

query.successExportDesc: Whether the Current Query Was Executed Successfully
query.messageExportDesc: Information Returned by the Current Query

uiComp.autoCompleteCompDesc: An input field that provides suggestions as you type, enhancing user experience and accuracy.
uiComp.inputCompDesc: A basic text input field allowing users to enter and edit text.
uiComp.textAreaCompDesc: A multi-line text input for longer form content, such as comments or descriptions.
uiComp.passwordCompDesc: A secure field for password input, masking the characters for privacy.
uiComp.richTextEditorCompDesc: An advanced text editor supporting rich formatting options like bold, italics, and lists.
uiComp.numberInputCompDesc: A field specifically for numerical input, with controls for incrementing and decrementing values.
uiComp.sliderCompDesc: A graphical slider component for selecting a value or range within a defined scale.
uiComp.rangeSliderCompDesc: A dual-handle slider to select a range of values, useful for filtering or setting limits.
uiComp.ratingCompDesc: A component for capturing user ratings, displayed as stars.
uiComp.switchCompDesc: A toggle switch for on/off or yes/no type decisions.
uiComp.selectCompDesc: A dropdown menu for selecting from a list of options.
uiComp.multiSelectCompDesc: A component that allows selection of multiple items from a dropdown list.
uiComp.cascaderCompDesc: A multi-level dropdown for hierarchical data selection, such as selecting a location.
uiComp.checkboxCompDesc: A standard checkbox for options that can be selected or deselected.
uiComp.radioCompDesc: Radio buttons for selecting one option from a set, where only one choice is allowed.
uiComp.segmentedControlCompDesc: A control with segmented options for quickly toggling between multiple choices.
uiComp.fileUploadCompDesc: A component for uploading files, with support for drag-and-drop and file selection.
uiComp.fileUploadCompKeywords: file, upload, drag and drop, select
uiComp.dateCompDesc: A date picker component for selecting dates from a calendar interface.
uiComp.dateRangeCompDesc: A component for selecting a range of dates, useful for booking systems or filters.
uiComp.timeCompDesc: A time selection component for choosing specific times of the day.
uiComp.timeRangeCompDesc: A component for selecting a range of time, often used in scheduling applications.
uiComp.buttonCompDesc: A versatile button component for submitting forms, triggering actions, or navigating.
uiComp.linkCompDesc: A hyperlink display component for navigation or linking to external resources.
uiComp.scannerCompDesc: A component for scanning barcodes, QR codes, and other similar data.
uiComp.dropdownCompDesc: A dropdown menu for compactly displaying a list of options.
uiComp.toggleButtonCompDesc: A button that can toggle between two states or options.
uiComp.textCompDesc: A simple component for displaying static or dynamic text content inclusive Markdown formatting.
uiComp.tableCompDesc: A rich table component for displaying data in a structured table format, with options for sorting and filtering, tree Data display and extensible Rows.
uiComp.imageCompDesc: A component for displaying images, supporting various formats based on URI or Base64 Data.
uiComp.progressCompDesc: A visual indicator of progress, typically used to show the completion status of a task.
uiComp.progressCircleCompDesc: A circular progress indicator, often used for loading states or time-bound tasks.
uiComp.fileViewerCompDesc: A component for viewing various types of files, including documents and images.
uiComp.dividerCompDesc: A visual divider component, used to separate content or sections in a layout.
uiComp.qrCodeCompDesc: A component for displaying QR codes, useful for quick scanning and information transfer.
uiComp.formCompDesc: A container component for building structured forms with various input types.
uiComp.jsonSchemaFormCompDesc: A dynamic form component generated based on a JSON schema.
uiComp.containerCompDesc: A general-purpose container for layout and organization of UI elements.
uiComp.collapsibleContainerCompDesc: A container that can be expanded or collapsed, ideal for managing content visibility.
uiComp.tabbedContainerCompDesc: A container with tabbed navigation for organizing content into separate panels.
uiComp.modalCompDesc: A pop-up modal component for displaying content, alerts, or forms in focus.
uiComp.listViewCompDesc: A component for displaying a list of items or data, where you can place other components inside. Like a repeater.
uiComp.gridCompDesc: A flexible grid component for creating structured layouts with rows and columns as an extension to the List View component.
uiComp.navigationCompDesc: A navigation component for creating menus, breadcrumbs, or tabs for site navigation.
uiComp.iframeCompDesc: An inline frame component for embedding external web pages and apps or content within the application.
uiComp.customCompDesc: A flexible, programmable component for creating unique, user-defined UI elements tailored to your specific needs.
uiComp.moduleCompDesc: Use Modules to create Micro-Apps designed for encapsulating specific functionalities or features. Modules can be then embedded and reused across all Apps.
uiComp.jsonExplorerCompDesc: A component for visually exploring and interacting with JSON data structures.
uiComp.jsonEditorCompDesc: An editor component for creating and modifying JSON data with validation and syntax highlighting.
uiComp.treeCompDesc: A tree structure component for displaying hierarchical data, such as file systems or organizational charts.
uiComp.treeSelectCompDesc: A selection component that presents options in a hierarchical tree format, allowing for organized and nested selections.
uiComp.audioCompDesc: A component for embedding audio content, with controls for playback and volume adjustment.
uiComp.videoCompDesc: A multimedia component for embedding and playing video content, with support for various formats.
uiComp.drawerCompDesc: A sliding panel component that can be used for additional navigation or content display, typically emerging from the edge of the screen.
uiComp.chartCompDesc: A versatile component for visualizing data through various types of charts and graphs.
uiComp.carouselCompDesc: A rotating carousel component for showcasing images, banners, or content slides.
uiComp.imageEditorCompDesc: An interactive component for editing and manipulating images, offering various tools and filters.
uiComp.mermaidCompDesc: A component for rendering complex diagrams and flowcharts based on Mermaid syntax.
uiComp.calendarCompDesc: A calendar component for displaying dates and events, with options for month, week, or day views.
uiComp.signatureCompDesc: A component for capturing digital signatures, useful for approvals and verification processes.
uiComp.jsonLottieCompDesc: A component for displaying Lottie animations, providing lightweight and scalable animations based on JSON data.
uiComp.timelineCompDesc: A component for displaying events or actions in a chronological order, visually represented along a linear timeline.
uiComp.commentCompDesc: A component for adding and displaying user comments, supporting threaded replies and user interaction.
uiComp.mentionCompDesc: A component that supports mentioning users or tags within text content, typically used in social media or collaborative platforms.
uiComp.responsiveLayoutCompDesc: A layout component designed to adapt and respond to different screen sizes and devices, ensuring a consistent user experience.

file.maxSizeTooltip: The Maximum Size of Uploaded Files with Optional File Size Units (e.g., '5kb', '10 MB'). If No Unit Is Provided, the Value Will Be Considered a Number of Bytes.

table.totalTooltip: The Default Value is the Number of Current Data Items, Which Can Be Obtained from the Query, for Example: '{{query1.data[0].count}}'
table.columnValueTooltip:
'{{currentCell}}': Current Cell Data
 '{{currentRow}}': Current Row Data
 '{{currentIndex}}': Current Data Index (Starting from 0)
 Example: '{{currentCell * 5}}' Show 5 Times the Original Value Data.
table.statusTooltip: Optional Values: Success, Error, Default, Warning, Processing
table.fixedHeaderTooltip: Header Will Be Fixed for Vertically Scrollable Table
table.fixedToolbarTooltip: Toolbar Will Be Fixed for Vertically Scrollable Table Based on Position
table.refreshButtonTooltip: The Current Data Changes, Click to Regenerate the Column.
table.changeSetDesc: An Object Representing Changes to an Editable Table, Only Contains the Changed Cell. Rows Go First and Columns Go Second.
table.selectedRowDesc: Provides Data for the Currently Selected Row, Indicating the Row That Triggers a Click Event If the User Clicks a Button/Link on the Row
table.selectedRowsDesc: Useful in Multiple Selection Mode, Same as SelectedRow
table.sortColumnDesc: The Name of the Currently Selected Sorted Column
table.sortDesc: Whether the Current Row Is in Descending Order
table.pageOffsetDesc: The Current Start of Paging, Used for Paging to Get Data. Example: Select * from Users Limit '{{table1.pageSize}}' Offset '{{table1.pageOffset}}'
table.displayDataDesc: Data Displayed in the Current Table
table.dataDesc: The JSON Data for the Table
table.rowColorDesc: Conditionally Set the Row Color Based on the Optional Variables: CurrentRow, CurrentOriginalIndex, CurrentIndex, ColumnTitle. For Example: '{{ currentRow.id > 3 ? "green" : "red" }}'
table.cellColorDesc: Conditionally Set the Cell Color Based on the Cell Value Using CurrentCell. For Example: '{{ currentCell == 3 ? "green" : "red" }}'
table.saveChangesNotBind: No Event Handler Configured for Saving Changes. Please Bind at Least One Event Handler Before Click.
table.dynamicColumnConfigDesc: Dynamic Column Settings. Accepts an Array of Column Names. All Columns Are Visible by Default. Example: ["id", "name"]
table.toUpdateRowsDesc: An Array of Objects for Rows to Be Updated in Editable Tables.

video.controlsTooltip: Hide Video Playback Controls. May Not Be Fully Supported by Every Video Source.

video.endedDesc: Triggered When the Video Ends Playing

iframe.URLDesc: The Source URL for the IFrame Content. Make sure the URL is HTTPS or localhost. Also make sure the URL is not blocked by the browser's Content Security Policy (CSP). The header 'X-Frame-Options' should not be set to 'DENY' or 'SAMEORIGIN'.

switchComp.closeDesc: Triggered When the Switch is Turned Off

transformer.deleteMessage: Delete Transformer Success. You Can Use {undoKey} to Undo.
transformer.documentationText: Transformers are designed for data transformation and reuse of your multi-line JavaScript code. Use Transformers to adapt Data from queries or components to your local App needs. Unlike JavaScript query, transformer is designed to do read-only operations, which means that you cannot trigger a query or update a temporary state inside a transformer.

temporaryState.valueTooltip: The Initial Value Stored in the Temporary State Can Be Any Valid JSON Value.
temporaryState.pathTypeError: Path Must Be Either a String or an Array of Values
temporaryState.unStructuredError: Unstructured Data {prev} Can't Be Updated by {path}
temporaryState.deleteMessage: The Temporary State is Deleted Successfully. You Can Use {undoKey} to Undo.
temporaryState.documentationText: Temporary states in Lowcoder are a powerful feature used to manage complex variables that dynamically update the state of components in your application. These states act as intermediary or transient storage for data that can change over time due to user interactions or other processes.

dataResponder.dataTooltip: When This Data is Changed, It Will Trigger Subsequent Actions.
dataResponder.docLink: Read More About the Data Responders...
dataResponder.deleteMessage: The Data Responder is Deleted Successfully. You Can Use {undoKey} to Undo.
dataResponder.documentationText: When developing an app, you can assign events to components to monitor changes in specific data. For instance, a Table component might have events like "Row select change", "Filter change", "Sort change", and "Page change" to track changes in the selectedRow property. However, for changes in temporary states, transformers, or query results, where standard events are not available, Data responders are utilized. They enable you to detect and react to any data modifications.

preLoad.jsLibraryHelpText: Add JavaScript Libraries to Your Current Application via URL Addresses. lodash, day.js, uuid, numbro are Built into the System for Immediate Use. JavaScript Libraries are Loaded Before the Application is Initialized, Which Can Have an Impact on Application Performance.
preLoad.urlTooltip: URL Address of the JavaScript Library, [unpkg.com](https://unpkg.com/) or [jsdelivr.net](https://www.jsdelivr.com/) is Recommended
preLoad.jsLibraryInstallFailedCloud:
Perhaps the Library is Not Available in the Sandbox, [Documentation](https://docs.lowcoder.cloud/build-apps/write-javascript/use-third-party-libraries#manually-import-libraries)
{message}
preLoad.jsHelpText: Add a Global Method or Variable to the Current Application.
preLoad.cssHelpText: Add Styles to the Current Application. The DOM Structure May Change as the System Iterates. Try to Modify Styles Through Component Properties.

editorTutorials.componentContent: The Right Component Panel offers you many ready made Application Blocks (Components). These Can Be Dragged onto the Canvas for Use. You Can Also Create Your Own Components with a little coding knowledge.
editorTutorials.canvasContent: Build your apps on the Canvas with a 'What You See Is What You Get' approach. Simply drag and drop components to design your layout, and use keyboard shortcuts for quick editing like delete, copy, and paste. Once a component is selected, you can fine-tune every detailfrom styling and layout to data binding and logical behavior. Plus, enjoy the added benefit of responsive design, ensuring your apps look great on any device.
editorTutorials.queryDataContent: You can create Data Queries Here and Connect to Your MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Airtable, and many Other Data Sources. After Configuring the Query, Click 'Run' to Obtain the Data and continue the Tutorial.

homeTutorials.createAppContent: Welcome to {productName}, Click 'App' and Start to Create Your First Application.

componentDoc.methodUsage: You Can Interact with Components Through Their Methods, and You Can Call Them by Their Name Anywhere You Can Write JavaScript. Or You Can Call Them Through the 'Control Component' Action of an Event.
componentDoc.basicDemoDescription: The Following Examples Show the Basic Usage of the Component.
